title.narrative: GWP-MED Making Water Cooperation Happen in the Mediterranean.
GWP-Med Skapa vattenresur samarbeten vid medelhavet

description.narrative: GWP-MED har ansökt om 25 miljoner kronor för insatsen "Making Water Cooperation happen in the Mediterranean" under perioden 2015-2018. Insatsen syftar tll att förbättra och stärka ett hållbart nyttjande av regionala och gränsöverskridande vattenresurser med ett fokus på MENA regionen för att därigenom stärka regional stabilitet och fred. Annan finansiering för insatsen har säkrats i storleksordningen 9 miljoner kronor.

GWP-MED has applied for funding of 25 MSEK to carry out the programme "Making Water Cooperation happen in the Mediterranean" during the period 2015-20198.
The project aims at making tangible advancements on priority issues of sustainable water resources management, at regional and transboundary levels in the Mediterranean with a focus on the MENA region, as means for enhanced regional cooperation among countries and towards meeting sustainable development objectives and strengthening regional stability and peace.
In addition to the funding applied for from Sida an additional 9 MSEK in co-financing has been secured so far and additional co-financing will be sought during the project period.

The Project ‘’Making Water Cooperation happen in the Mediterranean” aims at making tangible advancements on priority issues of sustainable water resources management, at regional and transboundary levels in the Mediterranean with a focus on and for the benefit of MENA countries. Through targeted, multi-purpose activities, the Project is expected to enhance regional cooperation towards sustainable development objectives shared among countries of the region.The expected outcomes of this intervention can be summerized as follows: - The Water-Food-Energy-Ecosystems Nexus agenda would be better understood in the region;- Cooperation on the North Western Sahara Aquifer System would be advanced and a shared vision for the management of the joint resource would be agreed upon;- Two major political processes on climate change, led by UfM and MAP UNEP, would be assisted in advancing and aligning, as appropriate;- A range of actors would be more aware about the Nexus and the climate change-related political processes and selected stakeholder groups i.e. Parliamentarians, Media, Women/Gender and Youth would be more able to contribute towards water security and water cooperation issues in the region.

participating-org.narrative: MIO-ECSDE/Mediterranean Information Office For Environment Culture And Sustainable Development

sector.narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management

tag.narrative: 13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.

15.1 - By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and drylands, in line with obligations under international agreements.

15.1 - Till 2020 bevara, återställa och hållbart använda ekosystem på land och i sötvatten och deras ekosystemtjänster, särskilt skogar, våtmarker, berg och torra områden, i enlighet med de skyldigheter som anges i internationella överenskommelser.

6.3 - By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse globally.

6.3 - Till 2030 förbättra vattenkvaliteten genom att minska föroreningar, stoppa dumpning och minimera utsläpp av farliga kemikalier och material, halvera andelen obehandlat avloppsvatten och väsentligt öka återvinningen och en säker återanvändning globalt.

description.narrative: As per the Agreement between Sida and GWP-Med, Annual Review Meetings will be held to discuss progress and monitor the implementation of the project (Article 6). The Meetings shall be based on the Annual Progress Reports (narrative and financial) and following the reporting modalities exemplified in Article 5 of the Agreement. The 3rd Annual Review Meeting was held on May 14, 2019 in Amman, utilising the presence of the GWP-Med in Amman on the occasion of the GWP Annual Regional Days that were held in Amman (13-16 May 2019)- covering activity period 1 January 2018 to 31 December 2018 Sida expressed content with the timely submission and the overall content of the Third Annual Progress Report. Based on brief presentation of progress per sub-component/activity line by GWP-Med,the progress report provided good level of details on the implementation of activities under the main two component of the project. In the COP only brief update will be mentioned *On Component 1 (promoting cooperation on transboundary water resources) - Implementation of activities was done as planned. - The only deviation was on the dates of the 1st Nexus Conference in the MENA and wider Mediterranean, that shifted from July 2018 to 26-28 November 2018, upon the request of Lebanon as the host country. - Additional related knowledge outcomes include the collaboration with the Joint Research Centre (JRC) of the European Commission on the ‘Nexus Atlas’. With about 40 cases collected already, the Nexus Atlas includes a publication and an online tool to make this knowledge available to wider audiences in a professional and sustainable manner. It was clarified that there has been no financial contribution to this from the Sida resources of the Matchmaker project until now; meetings of the Matchmaker are used for promoting/advancing the work of the Nexus Atlas. The synergy and aimed outcomes were positively commented by Sida. * On Component 2 (promoting cooperation on climate change adaptation objectives through regional processes), focus has been on supporting the development of the UfM Water Agenda, including through the development of 3 regional framework thematic programmes building on a puzzle of projects under each one (either existing projects that are brought in or new projects through new sources). In terms of cross-financing of activities, it was noted that when the Matchmaker started, Sida’s support to the UfM was not there yet. Moreover, it was reminded that the section on the work with UNEP MAP was completed during the Matchmaker’s first year of implementation. Financial Report and Audit GWP-Med re-confirmed that the Project’s scope of work focuses exclusively on MENA countries and Sida funds are used accordingly. Inclusion of non-MENA countries, for example in the framework of the Regional Nexus Dialogues (Component 1) or the activities under Component 2, is covered through matching resources from other sources (duly presented in the annual progress reports) and has no implications for the Sida budget. GWP-Med affirmed that until the end of 2019, another appx. 800-900k euros will be used. Therefore, about 2m euros will have been used in total until that time. GWP-Med reminded about the difference of amounts due to currency exchange is at the order of 180k euros until now, and this loss has been covered through alternative resources.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
